page.title: 01CURRIE GENERAL SYNOPSIS
page.content: CURRIE IS A SUBURB OF EDINBURGH. THERE IS A VARIETY OF MAIN ROADS, RESIDENTIAL STREETS AND COUNTRY LANES. CURRIE HAS MANY HOUSES, SOME BUNGALOWS AND SOME VILLAS, AND A FEW FLATS.MOST OF THE HOUSES HAVE GARDENS. THE MAIN ROAD IS LANARK ROAD (A70) WHICH IS VERY BUSY AND NOISY.CARS,BUSES,LORRIES AND VANS ALL COME DOWN LANARK ROAD. THERE ARE ALSO FARMS WHICH ARE MAINLY FOR SHEEP FARMING BUT THERE IS DAIRY FARMING TOO AND WOODLAND AREAS. THERE IS A RIVER FLOWING THROUGH CURRIE, THE WATER OF LEITH. THERE ARE QUITE A FEW SHOPS IN CURRIE BUT THEY ARE JUST SMALL ONES, RUN BY FAMILIES. CURRIE HAS TWO HIGH SCHOOLS AND FIVE PRIMARY SCHOOLS. THERE IS A TANNERY. THERE IS A PAPER MILL IN BALERNO AND A QUARRY IN TORPHIN - BOTH PART OF THE CURRIE AREA.
